answers.author: Kathie Novak
answers.text:
If I understand your question, the elected official has a business that would provide good or services to the city?  I always recommend checking with your city attorney for the correct legal advice, but as a former elected official, this is a huge no-no.  There is a conflict of interest when the council member has a financial interest in the matter, which would obviously be true in this case.  In addition, even the appearance of a conflict of interest, or making decisions that bring personal gain to an elected official can be just as troublesome.  The goal in conflict of interest policies is to foster integrity in public service and promote the public's trust and confidence.
